service.name: Hosts File
service.description: the local file used for mapping host names to IP addresses

c:simple-property.name: augeasModuleName
c:simple-property.description: the name of the Augeas module/lens to use for loading and updating this Resource's configuration

c:simple-property.name: configurationFilesInclusionPatterns
c:simple-property.description: the absolute paths of the configuration files, delimited with pipe characters; wildcards are permitted in the last component of the path (e.g. /etc/cron.d/*)

c:simple-property.name: ipaddr
c:simple-property.description: The IP address of the host entry. The address may be an IPv4 address (e.g., 192.168.1.10) or an IPv6 address (e.g., fec0:0:0:bebe::2).

c:simple-property.name: canonical
c:simple-property.description: The canonical host name to refer to the IP address. Host names may contain only alphanumeric characters, minus signs ('-'), and periods ('.'). They must begin with an alphabetic character and end with an alphanumeric character (e.g., foo.mydomain.org). A canonical name can be mapped to only one IPv4 address and/or to only one IPv6 address.

c:simple-property.name: alias
c:simple-property.description: Optional aliases provide for name changes, alternate spellings, shorter host names, or generic host names (e.g., localhost); aliases should be newline or space separated).
